Therefore we must do all we can to erect a place of worship. We cannot hang down our heads and beat a retreat. We have no need to faint or to be discouraged. The converts at Ashfield have done their uttermost in purchasing a tent worth $175, and we now have two tents where meetings can be held. I gave 


                                   -273- 

five pounds toward the tent, and shall probably have to give 40 pounds toward the house of worship. The people's enthusiasm is now kindled, and we must not let it die down.
